newsitem.title: GERMANY: Feed rye flows into German intervention stores.
newsitem.headline: Feed rye flows into German intervention stores.

text.p: Some 29,748 tonnes of feed rye was offered into German grain intervention stores last week after 25,855 tonnes a week earlier, state intervention board BLE data showed on Monday.
Traders said offers came mostly from the north and north east. Barley was also offered.

Totals in the November-May 1996/97 intervention season lag those in the same 95/96 period. Total grain volumes offered by March 17 totalled 786,417 tonnes compared with 1,546,818 tonnes a year earlier.
The March buying-in price for all grains is 243.68 marks a tonne.
The offers are volumes that were accepted, but have not yet been delivered to stores, by the close last Friday.
Sellers may withdraw offers and BLE may refuse acceptance on quality grounds.
